summary: This bill, the Model Employee Reinstatement for Ill-advised Termination Act (MERIT Act), mandates the reinstatement of certain recently terminated probationary federal employees who were part of mass terminations. It defines 'affected probationary employees,' 'mass termination,' and other key terms. It outlines procedures for reinstatement, including notification, appointment, and payment of back pay in a lump sum. The bill also includes provisions for calculating payment amounts and reporting requirements from the Comptroller General and the Office of Personnel Management.
